intro: Alsine verna var. debilis, commonly known as slender alsike clover, is a low-growing annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and features small, trifoliate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
